result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Held open for 90 days for State to submit restitution summary for any  medical bills.  If none filed, none is due.
Payable to Agent during extended supervision.

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.   The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling, including psychological treatment.  The Defendant is to have no contact with the victim, V-B.L., C.M., or D.P., and any known gang members (except for any family members-they are permitted).  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant is not to possess any  weapons.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Judgment and Order AFFIRMED.
Petition for Review is DENIED, without costs.
It is Ordered and Adjudged by this court in an opinion filed on November 19, 2019 that the Judgment and Order AFFIRMED

A petition for review pursuant to Wis. Stat. 808.10 having been filed on behalf of defendant-appellant-petitioner, Joseph P. Pamonicutt, and considered by this court; It is ordered that he petition for review is DENIED, without costs.
The Petition for Review is Acknowledged
Judgment and Order AFFIRMED
